7LDpYg17VDxnYjHanug0nw.text: This place has been here for a LONG time and I'd never been! Went for a quick lunch with a friend - used the Groupon currently online. Food was good, standard Chinese, nothing to write home about, but it was served hot and fast. I had the shrimp and broccoli with a spring roll, and there was more shrimp than broccoli! That's a first! It wasn't a HUGE lunch portion but it was filling and I took half of it home. Quiet atmosphere, secluded on the side of a shopping center, lots of parking. A good option for Chinese in the area.

5CPJF43ag477oJUfEeFMWQ.text: Great food! Great service! We always enjoy our dinners here :) They're also on restaurant.com so you can get a great deal as well!!

J7KLQtKlq9EmeW_hkt5RmQ.text: After reading about some recent reviews, I decided to stop by to check out the lunch specials. Unfortunately I went on a Sunday, when they only offer the buffet. So, after reviewing the buffet options, and noticing it was $9.50, I figured why not. The Sunday buffet offers two soups, wings, two rices (brown & white) and 9 entrees, including beef with broccoli, sweet and sour chicken and shrimp, beef with peppers, seafood with cashews among a few.  I started with the egg drop soup and wasn't thrilled, a little luke warm. However, the fried chicken wings were good. As for the entrees, I tried the beef with broccoli, which was the first to go, and the cashew seafood, general tso's chicken and sweet and sour chicken. All were good, but overall I prefer fresh meals, served hot and fresh. Although they seemed to fill the trays often, they seemed to go pretty quickly and those that remained definitely lacked in heat.  Overall everything was good & servers seem to be all around to assist with anything. I am just not a buffet person, but will return on a weekday to check out a preferred dish only.

64imMl1-aOX32NmOdeIICw.text: We have eaten here for years. The food and service are both excellent.  They've ruined Chinese for me, because I can not find food this good elsewhere.

RDk2F3DGXZzvjtyhiJu43Q.text: Ok So we haven't eaten here in a long time. We used to eat here once a week because they had the best Chinese food around. Well we are here tonight and I have to say that it will be a very long time before I come back. The egg rolls were over cooked and old, the dough inside was yellow which indicates that they were old. The chicken was not very good either. Maybe they changed their chef but they need to do something ASAP. I can tell you not sure if I am coming back

YMzfb8fWMzehsdM50Kl6mw.text: Great for large groups! They have rooms with tables that can accomodate up to 12 at one table equipped with a large lazy susan. Food is also usually fast. I say usually as one dinner trip, it took us close to 45 min to be served and tables that came in after us were served before us and we saw one couple leave after waiting for a while. Service is a hit or miss, really depends on the day and who serves you. We have seen bad and we have seen great but keep in mind it isn't a five star French restaurant when setting expectations. Decor is a bit dark and dated. Not a big deal for us, we will continue to visit as we heart their mapo tofu. Mangolian beef with the soft wraps and chinese broccoli with oyster sauce are also on our reg list.  Often comes up on Groupon, we usually buy one our two.

TdO5SUSWCb-ON2f7VqjFmw.text: I had a Groupon so I check this place out. It was just 'ok'. I don't think I would go back even with savings from a Groupon. The rice was burnt and the beef and broccoli was very salty.

quaCTJO_qpTqJkkfJpW3Xw.text: For Chinese food this place gets a three (3 yelp stars) from me.  I love the Chinese Cabbage and that was about it.  The Beef Dish I ordered was too salty and the Beef was over cooked though I do not think that was the determining factor   it tasted too plain  for my dish I rate it 2.55 yelp stars.  The Pineapple Fritters were perhaps made exactly as they were supposed to be though I did not like them.  The batter was too thick, some were overcooked and some were undercooked (batter gooey on the inside) 1 yelp star.  The service was A-OK as in 3 yelp stars.    The Fish Tanks, Lighted Tree, Red Display Cases with carved tusks and Ceiling in the Bar show some potential in Decorating!    They had a good Monday night crowd for a Monday night and were doing a lot of takeout.  Not much concern that I only took one bite of my HUGE Dessert, nor when I told them I did not care for it and no offer to comp it!  It would NOT have helped me rate the dine any higher though.  I would eat here again if Charlotte did not offer any better Restaurant choices!

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Of China South - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Great Wall Of China South - Charlotte, NC, United States

vAZpbfxRlwEutXkbBglHuw.text: I use to love this restaurant until my last visit when reaches was at my table. The manager said I can take 20% off of your bill!! Thanks but no thanks! I have not been back.

Nsqc7addqyNmip96gk66EQ.text: The food was well prepared, had good taste and the aquarium was beautiful whit Nemo and Dory.

2bU9IBv_s_QzBoNkNYlSJg.text: Came here with some co-workers to try this place out.  The decor inside is very nice, with fish tanks and even an ivory tusk.  Since this is no cheap buffet place, we were seated to a table and had two menus, one for lunch and the other specials.  I choose the special, which was spicy shredded meat (forgot name) with celery and carrots with pork fried rice and egg roll.  The table with provided with complimentary bowl of crisps with sweat sauce and mustard sauce; they were not stale, so kudos there.  I also ordered a sweat tea (came with lemon), it was sweat and not watered down.  The meal itself was indeed spicy, but not too overpowering since I didn't sweat.  The fried pork rice was very good and the shredded meat with veggies complimented one another.  The egg roll was fat and yummy.  Overall, it was all very good and was able to clean the plate.  The menu and prices provided during lunch is what you would find at many other Chinese restaurants in the area, so there is nothing unique.  However, the flavors and how its prepared is definitely better than some in the area; this place is worth another visit.

4xq_aj2qvzEhzXvQ8XEcRw.text: Been here a couple times and the food has always been really good.  It helps persuade me to come here when Groupon nudges me.  Sa Cha Chicken and the Hot & Spicy Pork were on our plates today.  Both were delicious.  Their lunch specials are around $7 and come with rice and either an egg roll or spring roll.  Their sauces are good and their vegetables are fresh... that is what I crave when I am there.  I also had the hot & sour soup - very good. Some places have a weird version of it - but not here.  Worth a try.  Yum.

7b9Ct6qO6AjwHSegHL9Hag.text: Server immediately walked back to our table to challenge the 15% tip my mom left. Spoke to everyone at the table about it until my brother stood up and told him to go away.   After our family said goodnight following the Fathers Day celebration our inattentive server attempted to ruin, I walked back in. Found server, asked him to get his manager, the three of us talked about the disrespectful and inhospitable behavior.   Lame response from manager, no regrets or apology from server. Truly sad because the food (and other staff)) are wonderful.   Go somewhere that they demonstrate respect for their guests - this is not the place.

UiYMuC_UeL93Rs44Q8wnnw.text: We really appreciated the fast and friendly service from the staff.  Also, the owners came to the table to make sure everything was good.  They took the time to chat for a minute.The food we ordered was so delicious.  My favorite is the beef with broccoli and the wonton soup.  This is the perfect place for a large group of people.  There are rooms in the back where you can have privacy, and the main dining area is also very nice, with a really beautiful aquarium. My family and I always enjoy coming here for Chinese food.

dvnSe7svzp0iDtkEpQNgwA.text: I just walked in and told the the hostess I just wanted wonton soup, she seated me, a waitress came over and I ordered. She then rudely said I had to order at least $10 of food if I wanted to stay and eat in the restaurant. There were only maybe 3 tables with anyone at all in the place so it's not like they were busy and they have never said this to me before on the couple of other ocassions where I just came for their soup. I will never go here again.

prn9cmJyVNRVvoxsN0LE8Q.text: I've been in Charlotte for just over 4 years and I can tell you that Great Wall is the BEST I've had. Delicious food, hot and fresh ingredients. Try the Sesame Tofu, it's the best ever!!!! I highly recommend!

Nr5gQNmMtErGZSyE8pNt2A.text: This has been my favorite Chinese restaurant anywhere in the country for 30 years. Are there last night, and something tastes slightly different with the flavors. Still excellent, but you can tell that something slight has changed. Curious if maybe a main chef retired? Anyway, still excellent.

FLBAVuLyLnIf-lhRKQI5PQ.text: Sweet and sour chicken was not edible. First bite left a mound of wet flour in my mouth and two bites after were the same. The meal hit the trash. Crab Rangoon over fried and not good at all. Very dissapointed.

fl4VyFgAvMcPC3K0_a8DdQ.text: Been there couple of times, some times the food is good, sometimes are not. It's odd that their chef couldn't keep a stable level:(

_FoxfiPRAXGSilNifkHDaw.text: I've recently visited this place again because i did like the food. And the food was still ferocious. They don't skim on the sauce or meat. The sauce is very flavorful. I did takeout. So not sure about the service. But the sanitation grade has improved to 96. I'll return again. It's worth it. I'm glad I gave them a second chance.

yJJyHG-ld6kq-ujbKO0aZA.text: Good Chinese food, typical flavors but consistently good. I like their lunch can specials, including soup and egg roll. For take out I like general tso chicken, cold sesame noodles, and steamed dumplings are wonderful!! The dinner time is crowded so go early or order to go.

qpaQT15rKKtMfZxa7amDvw.text: First time here, so I gave them 4 stars. Excellent service, food very good , great atmosphere!

e1EMxR5dHqwbKzmeIiiH3w.text: We came here after a living social deal.  We wanted to come here anyways as we live close and it is one of the last places in the shopping center we need to try.  We were immediately seated.  Took a few minutes to get someone to us for a drink order, but after that service was fast.  We both ordered egg rolls and two entrees (sesame chicken and some other pork meal).  The rolls were okay, but they had shrimp in them, I'm not a fan of shrimp, wish I had known!!  Aside from that, the entrees were HUGE!  We both had leftovers, and a huge plus that it was still good for two more nights!  Such great flavored food!  We will be back for more!  My only other complaint is they added gratuity for the two of us, not sure if it was because of the living social deal or if that is normal, but we like to tip what we want.  Unfortunately our server got less than what we would haven given.

2Me6PE4fUSxM7hbg6Q6qnA.text: Best Chinese food in Charlotte.  The egg rolls are the best anywhere, especially the homemade wasabi mustard.  Yumm.

BEkwEEcEbnUFyiXFjQlhZw.text: We've been loyal customers here for years and were always happy about the food and service here. But our recent experience made me hesitated to come back again. The bill come with the tip amount pre-written for us. We have only two people and I don't think it's common for restaurant in the US to tell you how much tips you should pay. This is not respectful.

PjizCi5ZVr5vFJSFcguQDQ.text: I honestly dislike writing this review... I have always loved Great Wall for their quality of food.. The service is always hit or miss. Tonight.. I received abrasive service while picking up my order.   This is the reason for a 3 instead of 5. I generally leave a tip for services, however when there is an abrasive attitude given because I am clarifying whether an ingredient I am allergic to is in the food, there will not be a tip.   The food is fresh and tasteful.. Temperature perfect.. Service not consistent.

2zcz1G_PPdcdSSHTpzzmeQ.text: Really good food and really really fast. Good choice for standard chinese in the South Charlotte area. Full bar and open for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Of China South - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and broccoli with brown rice and eggroll. Good stuff!

bL00wwE95TSzjIZzZW1kbw.text: I don't know what happened today, always used to enjoy the food here! My chicken dish was so spicy it was not edible and I wasn't asked about how spicy. I mentioned it to the waiter and he brought me xtra sauce that was less spicy. This did not help the already drenched in sauce chicken. The Egg roll tasted really old....about an hour and a half later I got violently ill. I won't be going back.

4oXBw-2vcYzhyeJ3rOHgWQ.text: ASK FOR THEIR SECRET CHINESE MENU FOR CHINESE. IF YOU ORDER ORANGE CHICKEN & EGG ROLL AND COMPLAIN, WELL FUCK YOU. That being said, the beef in chili oil is gorgeous, string bean with pork is fantastic, special recommendation goes to wontom in hot oil. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable. This place is native Chinese foodie approved!

GlYRXhRG0JavbYrcKhuguQ.text: Went for dinner - large portions for the price We ordered vegetarian dishes and both dishes had a lot and I mean a lot of oil. The eggplant in garlic sauce was flavorless and not at all spicy even though we asked for spice. The mixed veg in garlic sauce was decent - actually tasted the garlic. Waiters were constantly walking around and refilling water and making sure we didn't need anything.  Also they serve these fried wonton strips with 2 sauces as soon as you sit down, which was nice and unexpected.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Of China South - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian dishes

LBBbN6rq4IgRn1IUF9mB9w.text: I'm only writing this to save someone else from wasting money. If you grew up on the west coast or somewhere that has a large china town you will be severely disappointed as you have been with all Chinese food you've tried in Charlotte.   I'm not even sure where to start, I'm still mourning the 30 dollars I just threw away. I ordered several things. I'll start with the beef chow mien. It was very soupy and did not have any noodles? Very strange. Moving on to the veggie spring rolls. Since when do veggie spring rolls include shrimp? New to me. The onion pancake was incredibly dry. I've always just bought these frozen from the Asian market and fried in a pan but have never had one that was dry. Remaining items, pot stickers, generals chicken, and white rice were incredibly bland and rice was so dry it was pretty much inedible.    Maybe I hit this place on an off night, but if you're looking for a new good Chinese place I say keep walkin' don't bother.

xDBnl0SKBLw2f8-PCXXsAg.text: Ordered egg roll, cold and overcooked to the point you could not cut the wrapper, sent back but the next one was not much better.  Won ton soup lukewarm and lacking taste.  Ordered chicken with cashews and pork fried rice.  Neither had any taste, left hungry.  Will not return.

Hg-EgyS6JfwHf29m4DQ-iw.text: I was greatly surprised at how friendly the service was and how good the food tasted. I have eaten at many many Chinese places for lunch and this is tied for top spot. They give you Chinese chip things before your meal with sweet sauce and hot sauce. They also have large fish tanks with exotic tropics fish. Overall great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Of China South - Charlotte, NC, United States

FEai1LLNxYmaKTdAwKFx2g.text: Stopped in for lunch, they have a pretty good lunch menu with comes Ruth steamed it fried rice and a spring or egg roll...  I tried the trio with shrimp, chicken and beef and they make it spicy! The food was hot when it arrived at the table and that extra spicy sauce really added to the flavor, I chose the steamed rice which was also very delicious and a perfect combination with the trio!  Everything was good enough to make me want to return and try something else!

X8uHUDVDM3XDxpGfK3I0Iw.text: Love love love this place and the food.  Have yet to get a bad meal. Yummmm. HAPPY family and wonton soup the best!

ArAiRNO8cYzuz1UYn0CG0A.text: Great Wall has become our go-to for takeout. We have tried quite a few dishes on multiple occasions and not yet been disappointed. But still we get the crab Rangoon every time. Still haven't made it inside for a sit down dinner though.

BtAE4u6xNdzC63XpaXMxvw.text: I have been coming here for many years. All good things must come to an end. The food and service is not the same.Other  then the beautiful salt water fish tank there is nothing to say nice about the place.

QEa2FhVhbso6qQ1U0NQzEA.text: Love this place! Friendly staff and they put your food in your box for you, I, definitely coming back. Check out their groupon deal too

K737hpXghkn62rxxlD_Zrg.text: Called to place a pick up order for some of the ladies at work. We got shrimp and Broccoli was spicy, General chicken spicy as well. Both came out pretty well. I asked if they had malgolian chicken and I was told that's only for dinner. I will probably try a new Chinese restaurant before I go back.

_60vMf3pw67hGEFT41csgw.text: Been coming to the GW for almost thirty years!  Back in 1982 it was one of the few places to eat in the Carmel Commons area.  (Other than Little Ceasars, Mamma Rosas in Pineville & Chucky Cheese).  Yah, I'm old.  I remember when Winn-Dixie was still in Carmel Commons.      Family owned.  SUPER FRIENDLY managers.  Gets busy on weekends.  VERY fast take-out service.  Once bumped into Jim & Tammy Baker during lunch.   Standard "American" Chinese food.  Poo Poo platter fun with the flaming sterno cauldron.  THEY DO HAVE A REAL CHINESE MENU, but you'll need to ask for it.    Bar Area waiting.  Kids love the multiple fish tanks.  Fun place to people watch.  Don't worry if your kid spills fried rice all over the floor.  They won't fret about it.    Always ask for the house made mustard and duck sauce if you're getting take-out.    Bummed Baskin Robbins closed. . .as for years we'd stuff outselves on Beef & Brocoli and then waddle down for a pint of Mint Choc Chip.  BE CAREFUL about drinking and driving.  CMPD and even Pineville patrol the area on a regular basis.  Better to get a cab than put yourself in that situation.

dKR_29cMiKA3YvDPvbtDng.text: This place is bad! The service is bad, the food is bad and the prices are high! With our party of 4, we had a similar experience as Christina L. Where different waiters/waitresses would come by and awkwardly take our order, then someone else would bring out that order and then someone else would arrive to help us further.. The crab rangoons were very small and tasted generic, like something I could buy frozen at food lion and the shrimp in our meals ALSO were not deveined... And every dish we ordered was flavorless and bland... The only thing I enjoyed was the wonton soup! And then at the end of our meal, around 9:45pm we stayed at the table to chat.. Being cautious that the restaurant hours printed on the door said they close at 11pm.. A waitress came to us at 10pm and said that they were closing and they needed us to pay now... O_o  So we got up to pay and leave and the cashier man ( looked like the manager ) was so cold.. He never asked how the food was or anything, just "this how much!" And swiped the cards... Such a waste of money and time.. Worst Chinese food ever!

F-yp3vWZM2ntLDtEVru5-w.text: Been coming here for years. Alex, Tiffany, Cathy and all the staff make me feel welcome. The food is always consistent and good. I generally take out but when dining in, the experience is always good. One thing you must do is spend some time looking at their salt water fish tanks. These tanks are incredible and worth visiting the restaurant just to enjoy them.

RJ02HGJfL-fM3u6pgWgkFA.text: Reading other reviews, I haven't experienced any inconsistancy in service or food quality, to me, it's always excellent. However, I always get the same dishes. I will say that their weekend buffet is nowhere as good as their regular entrees, so I no longer go for the buffet. Special Trio is one of the best dishes I've ever had, spicy and flavorful. Still one of the best Chinese places in town.

dO6oUjqBt4BuSQnR4dtclw.text: The BEST Chinese in charlotte. My boyfriend and I are regulars there. The food is amazing and the fish tanks are beautiful. If you are a vegetarian like myself they have plenty of option. I get the mixed veggies in brown sauce, SO GOOD!

r7EFTJR3JAS2JB69jW_aBQ.text: I have been going here for many, many years but on my last visit, the food was terrible.  The crispy shrimp was soggy and the egg rolls had a horrible taste and smell.  I was told by the lady at the front desk they were homemade but that was incorrect.  I have had fresh, homemade egg rolls and when you bite into them, you see the fresh cabbage inside.  What Great Wall of China South serves is cheap, frozen egg rolls.  I won't be back.

G0kZpHsdBbVgspXL2tr_8w.text: This is the Real Deal. Classic American Chinese food served fresh and hot with excellent service. I can't believe that I had never eaten here until I got a Groupon. I even suffered severe" Groupon Guilt" when the meal was over and the check came. To be completely honest I could not bring myself to use it on my first visit. The food had been too wonderful. The wait staff was too good. I ordered 3 entrees that day...figuring I would take home the leftovers. I had scallion chicken made with dark meat chicken (your choice) , fresh vegetables with tofu ( medium spicy) and chicken and broccoli . All were outstanding.. The atmosphere is hard to find anymore. Three large aquariums dominate the two levels of dining area. I chose a booth in the bar area that is right next to one of the tanks.It is soo relaxing to just watch the fish swim. You understand why Drs offices always had aquariums back in the 1900s. If you are looking for a Chinese food "fix" this is the place. I am tired of the little dingy take-out joints that are in every strip mall. This place is an escape to a more sophisticated era of Chinese restaurants in Charlotte. I also tried the lunch buffet and it was excellent. Enjoy.

9MLQBfJszNn6O3B9j2S2lA.text: Best hot & sour soup that I've ever had. I also love the hot spicy shredded beef, which is no longer on the menu but can be ordered. The Sunday buffet is nice with a good selection of dishes at a reasonable price. After our meal, my granddaughters love to watch the brightly colored fish in the large salt water tanks. Very friendly service. Groups can reserve the large rooms in the back, which close off for privacy and offer a lazy susan turntable in the center of the tables for sharing of menu items.

SLrKcIoPH2r6UKR65Hg9Sg.text: Absolutely horrible experience. We were seated and drink order was taken by that person. Few mins later drinks were dropped off by a different person who said waitress would be over to take our order. Then 10 mins later someone came over and asked us if we wanted appetizers which we did and ordered Crab Rangoons and Spare Ribs. This person said someone would be back to take our order. Never happened. The apps came out and the guy said again someone would come take our order. So we ate our apps and still no one. No one even acknowledged us, I had to flag someone down and I said "I think our waitress has forgotten about us..." The man says "what you want" ummm to order? Hes like "Yes, what you want just staring at us, no smile or apology. So we ordered and got our food about 10 mins later. Had to wait forever for our check. I think we had a different server every time someone stopped by. The Crab Rangoons were simply not Crab Rangoons. There was no cream cheese flavor whatsoever. I am not sure what they were, but not what I was expecting. The Shrimp Fried Rice tasted ok but the Shrimps were full of poo. Not deveined and completely packed with poo. Just disgusting. Wonton soup flavor was good but the actual wontons must have had a teaspoon of ginger in them. Strong and not really what I was expecting in a wonton...Whole dinner sucked. To top it off there was vomit all over the womens bathroom floor. No idea why this place was full. Many great chinese restaurants around, this is not one.

JipFyMeug52YVUSN96l79g.text: My husband and I went this past Saturday for dinner. I saw a few Chinese people there eating and thought to myself this food will be great. Because I usually judge a restaurant for being authentic if their own people go. I was wrong. The wait staff leaves a lot to be desired, the hosts are great. However, the gentleman passed by me literally 8 times and did not refill my water for a good 15 minutes. I basically had to flag him down and tell him to please refill it. We ordered the sesame cold noodles. Which I love the peanut sauce but way too much soy in there so it came off extremely salty. Also we order the favorite shrimp (which is that sweet mayo shrimp) and sesame chicken. Okay the favorite shrimp was disgusting. The sauce tasted old and I couldn't even stomach to eat it. The side of broccoli was just drizzle with soysauce and salty!  the sesame chicken was average however I did enjoy how they didn't soak it in sauce. I asked for extra vegetables and we were charged more for it but got literally just a spoon full of vegetables. Jade Asian Fusion and Dim Sum tastes so much better

4kuxhFNUuX1P-6LEziysxA.text: My family has enjoyed eating here since 1986 when we moved to Charlotte. The kids now request to eat there when they come home to visit. We love it...great cold noodles and dumplings!  It gets a 5 Yelp rating from me!

xME5TsEhG0aNllZwDjiMwA.text: This is one of my favorite chinese restaurants in the area. Their food is always fresh, hot and delicious. The service is superb. They're very attentive. I've become such a regular customer that they know  me by name. That makes me feel extra special. I've never experienced that at any other restaurant that I ever frequent on a regular basis.

GgsEa_UJG8S4SFoRzgYmqg.text: I've been going to this place for the past 15 years and it's definitely gone downhill recently. I used to rave about the food and service to all my friends, but recently my experiences have been pretty terrible. The owner and his waitstaff look as if they have just given up, there's never a smile on anyone's face, they all just look depressed. The food used to be amazing, but it seems as if they must have changed chefs because now everything usually ends up coming out either over done, or just drenched in way too much sauce. If you complain about the food, the waitstaff just acknowledge the complaint with a nod, walk away, and do nothing about it. I hate to write a bad review because I know how great it used to be, but it just seems as if owner stopped caring.

bM6l834YVYo14tC-wlu36A.text: During the first seven years I lived in Charlotte, I had lunch here at least three times a month.  The food and service has always been steady.  I always left feeling as though I received good value

pY_hXb74buQ7el-4CEcXVw.text: My family has been coming here for over 20 years and I've always had a great meal. Great specials, diversity, and service. I think this is the best Chinese restaurant in the Charlotte area. The best egg drop soup I've ever had.

rrhPZvFoqMPfa0sS6_HqQg.text: After much searching, we settled on Great Wall as our favorite  place for a basic Chinese meal.  The food is good, service is reliable and from visit to visit its consistent.  The setting is pedestrian but pleasant enough.  We do a lot of take-out and they make it easy.  Try the House Special noodles and the Sesame Shrimp.

L1HbOMr_poSWyW5lCSALeA.text: This is the BEST Chinese restaurant in Charlotte and maybe in the US.   The egg drop soup is fantastic, the service is great, and we've never had a bad meal there.   Anything you eat there will be the best you've ever tasted.  We eat there at least once a week.  I do carry out and my family looks forward to it!

H4tNQW9Z2zhLoLyr2PdMTQ.text: If there is a 0 star id rate this place. The owner is very ignorant. When I tried to order food, he literally told me that "he is way too busy to deal with me".  What a joke.  I liked the place before but they will never have my money no more.

EeMSPNTCbgyMBKWDX6t62Q.text: We dined here yesterday, at my brother's request for his birthday.  The atmosphere is nice, and we were greeted by a very pleasant hostess.  We were even seated by the fish tank; a real treat.  Our waiter, however, seemed to be having a bad day, or maybe not feeling well.  The service here is really hit or miss, either very good or really bad.  I ordered the Crispy Shrimp, expecting just that.  The waiter even warned me that it is spicy, which was fine with me.  What I received seemed to be maybe sweet and sour shrimp, I'm just not sure.  It was served with orange slices, in a big glop of gelatinous, sticky goop.  Nothing crispy or spicy about it!  It also had candied walnuts, which would have been great with a dessert.  I know a lot of people like really sweet entrees, I'm just not one of them, especially when expecting a crispy, spicy shrimp dish.  My brothers, however, enjoyed their meals; one had seafood lo mein, and the other a sizzling steak  (which is just a plate of meat and mushroom gravy, absolutely no vegetables!)  I got one shrimp down, and that was it for me.  My brothers each tasted a shrimp, but both passed on another bite.  The waiter never even returned to check on us, so I just ate a little rice to be polite while my brothers finished their meals.  The restaurant got kind of busy, and later the waiter finally showed up with the check, but didn't even comment on my basically untouched plate.  I asked him if this was Crispy Shrimp, and he sort of halfway nodded.  He did bring me a box, and at the price I paid, I decided to go ahead and take it, but I later dumped it in my brother's refrigerator ( a little extra birthday gift!).  I'm so happy my brothers enjoyed their meal, but I left hungry, with a much lighter wallet, and pretty disappointed.  I'll probably go back at some point, but will certainly hope for better service.  We all have our bad days, but even a simple smile would have gone a long way!  My advice is to try to make sure you know exactly what you're ordering, because the dinner menu gives little, if any, description and the waiter may or may not be helpful.

MrfApxEvqN7gnCKWfy-vcg.text: Two stars is probably too high of a rating. I do believe there has been a change of ownership here.  Great Wall was always perfect with take out orders.  Food was always hot, order was alway correct and always ready in the time quoted.  That has changed dramatically.  I thought the last time was a fluke but it has happened again.  I was told 15 minutes for pick up. Arrived 20 minutes after I ordered.  Food was not ready.  After 25 minutes my name was called and the order was incorrect.  The gentleman in charge told me I would need to take my order as is or wait another 15 minutes for the missing fried rice and soup.  Had to explain taking a carry out order back without someone's. Dinner was not an option not was waiting 15 minutes for something that should take less than five minutes.  Left 10 minutes later with my order and a "free" soup.  This is the last time we will order from Great Wall.  Wanfu is closer to our home and lately the food and service is much better.  Sad to see the  changes that have happened at Great Wall.  It was great.

8t-UJ2AqGvp7V6uhlAj1gQ.text: It seems like this restaurant has been here as long as I've lived here and probably longer. They have some of the most outstanding Chinese food in the area. The restaurant is pleasantly decorated and it kind a whisk you away like you're in another world or on vacation. I love that when I get to go out to eat - - the feeling of being somewhere exotic.  The place is always clean and the staff is always very friendly. Another one of our favorite go to places for big family events and birthdays etc.

G22I0qgoSVfWiWj8cC6Eew.text: The very best Chinese in Charlotte maybe NC.  Alex the owner was born in Tapai.  He lived in San Francisco for years and started his business and family in Charlotte back in the 80s.  His brown sauce is a secret recipe and only he makes it each day.  Absolutely the best.

WMznAiGzaMY14pXOiRvYoQ.text: The won ton soup the hot and sour soup was the best I've ever had. Even better then Chicago. I tried something new the special beef  delicious will order again but the great server said to order it less sweet. Two thumbs up you have to go and they also have traditional...

xtwwBPPxKRS3oFNhgkFPnQ.text: Ok the 4 stars is purely for the food, because honestly, I think the service here kind of sucks. But what can you say, generally at Asian establishments, lacking service is usually the trend. However, if you are craving AUTHENTIC Cantonese food, this place is it!! This is a hidden gem that you do not know about this place. Sure you can order the regular Americanized Chinese food. But why when you can get pea sprouts, steamed fish, steamed chicken, Chinese ribs with bean paste sauce etc? A pretty cool aquarium inside with live reef. The only downer is our waiter never bothered to come refill over beverages. She kind of took our order, dropped down our food and peaced out;. I think this place is definitely short staffed, the owner ended up coming out to bring out our checks.

0ikJFuZwqvQIMfPVZVzxuQ.text: Last night I had couple of sakis, pot stickers, won ton soup and the shrimp and scallops special. Delicious food and a wonderful attentive waiter.  Only down fall was a floor manager who was very loud talking about his own personal business, he reached over my sake (his tie touched it) to check my wife's tea. No excuse me etc. Additionally, he hovered in a bad way. Regardless, my waiter was awesome. The rest of the staff seemed good also. Tasty food.

FGOU9hSfeTyMPteAWFQ8-g.text: Been coming here once a week for 10+ years. Always great. Staple of my diet. Best Chinese in South Charlotte.

yQ3ozOjR1U4dB_2yk5hqrg.text: Ordered food to go and there was a black hair in both mine and my coworker's food. My hair is blonde so it definitely was not mine. Thankfully the manager gave a refund, however the restaurant needs to work on sanitation.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Of China South - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black hair in food.

MquCd_uCBQ748wLnLgSczg.text: Won't be back. Below average food. Great service. Shrimp was tough and tasteless. Cashews were stale.

AJHnSKESWT3nKAP7WsCMqQ.text: This is apparently not the best Chinese food I've got in my life compared to the ones in California or from my parents, but it tops my list of Chinese food in Charlotte.   Just for the food, I'll give a 4 star considering it's in Charlotte. (I'm referring to the authentic Chinese food menu.) The Jiang Ya (marinated duck) is my favorite. La zi Ji is also  decent.   The service was great for my experience. The waitress paid attention to what is left over on the table and asked why we didn't eat it and then exchanged a new one after we told her we simply didn't really like the flavor of the pork.   I'm giving five star here because I believe this place deserves more positive comments than It has now.

cktcfMH50AUUxR0UOT5QdA.text: I was so excited to  try this new place since I work near it and my daughter is moving 5 minutes away. I had not seen it before but though it looked very quiet. So I only ordered lunch. I went to the restroom while I waited for them to cook it. I got an egg roll and soup. I came out and she was all ready. I said wow, that was fast. Usually and egg roll takes a minute or two to cook. When I got back to the office I found out why. First no spoon or soy Sauce. then the egg roll was soggy. They did not even cook it fresh. Yuck. It was so bad. The egg drop soup had no flavor either. I woudl pass this place by in a heart beat. Had they been busy I woudl say, oh they are busy, but there was no one in the place. Learn that lunch people are the same people who come back for dinner people. yikes

P7lcNHPhhR7X6NuKH8CVQg.text: I do not give bad reviews often, but this one is one of them unforutnately.  My husband is from the west coast and he is picky about his Chinese food.  He thought he found a good place once on his lunch break and wanted me to try it for dinner, so we went.  It was aweful.  How can you mess up wonton soup and vegetable spring rolls.  The sesame chicken was terrible.  The shrimp with garlic sauce just ok.  And the waiter was MIA after we got our food...we wanted to get some extra white rice at least and then our check at the end took forever, it was bad.  We also returned that wonton soup back to the kitchen since it was so bad.  Lastly, I did not think a tip was deserved so I made that known...and the owner was pissed off and made sure to tell my husband about it, but honestly I do not care.  YOU NEED TO DO BETTER, CHINESE FOOD IN CHARLOTTE OFFICIALLY HAS A BAD NAME!

ebFcUyPEi0lOOVdk4Ns4-g.text: We didn't eat the food here because we arrived, ordered, and saw a cockroach crawling around the bowl of the crunchy noodles that they serve as a table item. When we attempted several times to flag down a waiter - who apparently wasn't OUR waiter - he ignored us. Our waitress came to apologize that he was ignoring us because our table isn't in his area. So we still have a cockroach hanging out at our table. The manager came out to ask about the situation and did not apologize and did not offer any compensation. We left and recommend you not patronize this place.

DdoI2OmvZfZW49D4lSZB2A.text: This chinese food is the best in Charlotte. Always fresh and never leaves you feeling crappy like other chinese foods can. It's a little more pricey than other chinese food places but I think it's worth it since it's so good.

InXUeARx_HPHZUC413HorQ.text: Great service and the food is awesome! One of the best Chinese restaurants I've been to in Charlotte! The Cantonese lobster is a must try!

8Cw3D799cRJhv07DxzsqnA.text: It's my second time here. This experience is much better than last time. The sweet and sour shrimp is a must try! Just can't stop eating them

CqsMjVrV664TikOQiB4jWg.text: I have been here several times and it's always been good. I've come here before for the sunday buffet and they actually have a lot of options. Egg rolls are so good and fat. Chicken wings are huge and crispy!! My favorite is the house special lo mein noodles. It has that smoky flavor and the put a lot of meat in it! Boyfriend loves their chicken and broccoli. I've also ordered from their Chinese menu. I tried the fish in the spicy oil sauce. It was good and light. staff is always friendly and I love when they seat us near the huge aquarium.

vezNTBcZicU_Ga_5CBXMdw.text: It's relatively empty for a Sunday afternoon. I think that there are 4 tables altogether with diners. I ordered a spring roll, and an egg roll. They were fairly tasteless and warm. I think Chef Mike is at work. The spareribs were nice and hot and meaty. We saved the bones for the dogs. Our waitress gave us a small bag to put them in.  Well our entrees arrived and we had both ordered orange beef. Hers was mild and mine was supposed to be hot and spicy. Mine was not spicy at all, what a shame. The orange sauce was nice but there was very little rind present. The meat was very chewy. Overall I really don't think that we'll be coming back again. Three stars for the wonderful aquariums and our waitress,  the food was a complete miss.

qMAIzXzoQkdo1IMRic8-gA.text: Great food, great prices, friendly, and consistently taste the same each visit. Always packed with a decent crowd during lunch time but still manage to get in and out under an hour.

5bwqNyJT9aaaJZme-1sC6Q.text: Very good Chinese food. We've had several meals here and all have been good. The wait staff does a good job explaining the menu. There's no cocktail menu but just tell them the ingredients & they aim to please. Going a little before rush 5pm makes for quicker service. Orders can be called in & picked up. Not sure about delivery since we live out of the Pineville area.   Nice for couple and family meals. We usually request additional chili to be brought to add to our meals. Efficient and not rushed during our meals.   FYI - There is a private room for special events if needed.

Qu5PBTWgNeKVTaqetKyNyA.text: Five years ago we first experienced Great Wall and it was excellent.  Then it entered the land of yuck and for four years we have not returned until a couple of our neighbors invited us to join them.  We really did not want to eat at Great Wall, but did, just to be neighborly.  And are we glad we did!  The Charlotte Observer food critic had mentioned that they had a new chef and kitchen crew and it shows.  We both raved at how wonderful the food was.  Portions were very large, more for sharing than for one person.  Flavors were back with each bite bringing yet another certain spice or tang or texture.  I usually order the combinations like one of their two specials shrimp, beef and chicken and another variety of different meats.  Excellent!  The service was prompt and the waiter very authentic being a bit hard to understand but he accommodated all of our unique requests.  As to spicy, it was not, so if you are like us who prefer a kick to our food, we think you need to specifically go for extra spicy.  Their normal spice level was not detectable, but the food still was good.  Thank you for bringing back the excellent Chinese food and dishes from five years ago.  For those of you who have or had kissed off the Great Wall...come back and be pleasantly surprised.  I am holding my breath for a return visit hoping that our recent experience was not a fluke.  Oh I certainly hope not.

Ofj9TOumhpUmjS2z1LL5Pg.text: My boyfriend and I came here and the food is amazing!  We also got the scallion pancakes, egg roll and spring roll not pictured here and it was delicious!  The pictures include chicken and broccoli and the Four Happiness with brown rice.  These were some of the best Chinese food around Charlotte.  I will definitely come back for more!

xPKOzR2ghJUFRmo76qry7A.text: Good Chinese food quick. No frills American Chinese, great service and an extensive menu. A lot of the dishes here are served with dark meat, the will do all white if you ask.

CAPkiD67HkEXThkA0csPcQ.text: Deeply Disappointed, nondescript entrees.  I was really looking forward to trying this restaurant. I was really hoping it would be good. No such luck! We ordered General Tso Chicken, Garlic Beef and additional stir fried vegetable entrees.  They all taste the same. Dark brown sauce with too much corn starch and no spices. Garlic was not in the beef. Chicken should be a little sweet with a small kick of heat in a light sauce. I specifically asked to make it Szechuan level of  spicy. What we got was 3 entrees that were so gummy and bland. I look for pieces of garlic and ginger and found none. When I can make better stir fry at home using fresh spices that have a dramatic distinction between each dish, you know it's not a place you want to eat. Nothing authentic or Chinese about this food. Very poor experience and  totaI waste of money. Sad, as I  was really rooting for them. ;-(

8jtUzcKkFLW08nokzlc-FA.text: This was our first time here, there were four of us the place was not crowded but we had to wait for a table. Our waitress was very attentive but again we waited a good forty minutes to get our food. My friends food was way over cooked and I did not get what I had ordered. Dont think we'll be going back.

QIfv7o8GgSK-7ucGX8RKwQ.text: I called at 9PM TO MAKE A TAKE OUT ORDER. the owner asked me my name and advised me that it will be ready in 20min.   After 20min I went to the restaurant and paid for my order. To find out that they haven't even started making my order. I guess they was waiting to get payment first before they started making the food. And if that is the case they should have told me that in the first hand.   Needless to say that I had to wait another 20min for my food to be ready.   I haven't even tasted the food yet so I will update this review after I eat.

J65xIwo9zxftI8jZ85Wk3A.text: Great atmosphere.  Nice to have good sit down Chinese food.  Service great.  Servers so great with our kids.  Love the lady Susan for appetizers.  Kids love it. Good Vegan options for me and my meat eating family love everything they've ordered!

FWsMGogdOCMLZc293PNP0A.text: Nope, not a fan. Crab Ragoon and chicken wings was overcooked, rice was refried with oil taste that you get when it's old. Service was friendly, seating was good but sadly the food wasn't enough for us to come back.

FkdR7m48iRfTibp-2GJ-Eg.text: Their inspection grade is 94. The 90 had more to do with changeover in management  then other problems. Having said that I have been their for lunch and the Sunday buffet. The customer service was good. They are friendly. I thought the food was ok but not up to the old Great Wall standards

nezoB333ePNq6iqVigkNvg.text: Love ordering take out from here. The staff is super fast and friendly. Food is delicious. I enjoy the shrimp lo mein, General Tso's chicken, beef and broccoli and egg rolls. The Sunday buffet is also excellent.

In fact, this dinner is all he talked about during his visit.  We had Mai Tai for drinks and they were excellent.

Uze2U5YR1nOBdj8znQsxOw.text: Been searching for my goto chinese restaurant in Charlotte- Found it!  perfect flavors, huge portions, friendly prompt service - What more can you ask?

siORzuO63eVzB6oGRNxIBg.text: We were looking for good take out Chinese food and decided on Great Wall. The food was pretty average, not bad, but not great. The staff was super friendly and prices were reasonable. We just were hoping for something a bit more flavorful. We ordered Sweet and Sour chicken, chicken fried rice, broccoli beef, fried pork dumplings and steamed vegetarian dumplings.  Our daughter had eaten there before and thought she had seasame chicken, which she said was good. So we may try again.

675HDqTppvX6MUsHT-52JA.text: I've been going to this Chinese restaurant for longer than I came remember. In that time, I've had a one or two minor issues. My favorite is the sesame chicken. There is amble parking but it does it crowded on the weekends.

RliMCfW3JabL-XbKBu3k8w.text: My wife's favorite. Food is top notch and fresh for Chinese.  They have a Sunday buffet that is amazing.  We don't normally like buffets but they have great fresh food. Always have a great meal here.  More pricey than others but you get what you pay for.

QWoRo0NjtarRAQ0p49Ezug.text: So it's time to update my review of this restaurant. I'll be honest I stopped going there based on the bad visits a few years back. But I came back and am glad to say the restaurant is updated and the food was too.    The cook did great at preparing delicious meals that we knew and loved.  I ordered a meal no longer on the new updated menu and no problem they fixed it ! Lake Tung Ting Shrimp- jumbo shrimp with veggies in a light white sauce. It was delicious!  The hubs had beef with veggies and it also was very delicious.  I was surprised and very pleased that the restaurant finally offered actual brown rice. The use to offer rice with soy sauce and called it brown rice but now they actually serve authentic brown rice!!! Yeah   The interior dinning areas have had nice updates including fresh paint & new modern tile designs on the walls that brings this 1980's Charlotte landmark into the 20th century !!!   The staff are efficient as ever and well this is the Great Wall Restaurant I knew and loved for so many years.  Glad I came back - I'd say you should stop in and try it ... two thumbs up!

bNNj56Z-sWUDUb4leXhw1A.text: Walked in to a completely empty restaurant except for the folks who worked there. I thought it was strange but just blew it off thinking there would be more folks arriving later. The chicken lettuce wraps we ordered were decent, nothing great about them. The waitress was very nice. I ordered garlic chicken and my kid ordered orange chicken. The orange chicken looked decent and wasn't too bad. My garlic chicken tastes weird. The sauce and veggies that were in and on it were tasty but the chicken didn't have the consistency of real chicken. It had no real texture, was softer than bread, melted with one bite, and had a funky taste to it. It was clear that this was a seriously processed meat PRODUCT. Ewwww. I told the waitress and she brought her "manager" over. As soon as he opened his mouth, he had a major attitude. "So you don't like your food" he said in a snarky tone. I then said, "This chicken tastes funny, it's not real chicken or something, the texture isn't consistent with real chicken" He was visibly pissed then asked if he could remove the plate. He then said, "Do you mind if I taste it?" I said, "Go ahead". He then stuck his fingers in the plate, grabbed a piece and shoved it in his mouth. As he was chewing he said, "You know, I had chicken from here earlier today with no problems"  Looks like his taste buds suck! Then he said after swallowing it, he begrudgingly said that the chicken was a bit SOFT and he would remove it from my bill.   The waitress came back over to offer me a different dish but I declined and just asked for my bill. This place will never get on track if they continue to purchase "pretend chicken" and try to pass it off as the real thing. The "manager" need to be retrained or terminated. I saw they have a groupon to eat at their restaurant.....because they need business. I gave it two stars because the waitress was so nice. I wonder what is keeping people out of their restaurant?? Bad food? Bad management? The fish stinks from the head down. Don't eat here.

dNBJIzYJ5hxuYsA7e0cCyQ.text: I'd say more of a 3.5 star. But I had a groupon which made it a good value. My husband use to come here for their buffet back in the day & said it was actually really good for a buffet. So coming back from the beach thought it would be a quick easy stop for dinner. Except they dont have a dinner buffet at least not on Sundays oops. No worries i just went with the pad thai which as their menu states comes with thinner noodles than tradital pad thai. Not my favorite but the flavor and spice of the pad thai was delicious. Maybe one of the best I've had in Charlotte. Seriously if you like spicy you should give it a try. To me $15 is high especially when the majority of the dish is noodles and the shrimp were cheap small probably frozen. I'd go back with  a geoypon or if it was closer to $10 range.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Of China South - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy pad thai. Awesome flavor but vermicelli noodles vs traditional pad thai. Still awesome dish!

99ifJWGbT78_n3MrJwYUKg.text: Who says you need to hop on a plane to see one of the 7 wonders of the world? You can just come here for  the Sunday buffet. While i have been here many times for the buffet this review is for the selections off the menu. The Singapore Rice Noodle with yellow curry was really good. Plenty of flavor and satisfied my craving for noodles. Plenty of both shrimp and chicken. The shrimp were good but the smaller ones. We also had an order of the Pad Thai which used the same noodle I believe.  Loved how spicy it was and the waiter even asked beforehand if we were okay with it being spicy : I believe prices could be a buck or two less but will say that they give you plenty of food. We even had leftovers. Service was great and really enjoyed coming here. Will be sure to be back on another Sunday during lunch buffet hours and will update my review then.

It's probably mostly a nostalgia thing, as this place reminds me of some Chinese restaurants that my parents and I would visit when I was a child. They place fried noodles with duck sauce for dipping on the table when you're seated. The house lo mein is yummy, fried rice is just your average take out style, good general chicken and delicious beef ho fun. If you're lucky you'll get to sit next to the big fish tank and relax while watching Dory and Nemo swim by. ;)

KYhtIrRY-UXyLBJlAMwTFg.text: We ordered takeout from here on a Sunday night. I was Impressed that my food was ready when I got there ten minutes later.  There were plenty of staff to help at the register, as many of us were picking up our to go orders. They were all super friendly.   The restaurant was fairly busy with patrons dining in too!   We ordered Sesame Chicken, shredded duck, white rice and egg rolls.  The food was good but nothing that stood out.

eXaWWPI9ysHP62SWBi_JpA.text: First thing I saw as I walked in was the sanitation score: 90.5.   Not impressive.   I was told by my lunch companion that one of the last scores was below  90. The entire reason that I lunched here is because my friend, Deanna, told me that it was such a good place for Chinese food. She has been going to this restaurant for 35 years.  I had the chicken steamer, which was okay.  The iced tea did not taste home brewed; it tasted stale.  Overall, nothing to write home about. I compare all Chinese food to the Chinese restaurant across the street from South Park Mall (Baudin?).   That steamer is much better there.   The Great Wall of China South was a big space with few patrons.  The patrons that I passed when we were leaving the restaurant were talking about the sanitation scores.   We gave each other a nod of disapproval.   I think this restaurant may be surviving on their legacy of days gone by.  In order to be great, they will need to up the quality of their food, update their decor, and correct their low sanitation score. I will give them a shout out for having decent service. Our server was pleasant and efficient, but just couldn't make up for the low sanitation score. This restaurant has their work cut out for them, but anything is possible.  I hope they make it because I know they are a treasured establishment in this part of Charlotte.  Deanna told me so.

7vcW3MEEYYCqaX4ViM3Edw.text: Thiis is the second time I have given them a second chance, the first time the food was in adequate, and forgot any of the condiments I ordered vegetable rolls and hot and sour soup that were left out, never going back!!! New owners are terrible

-Ci_elpME4zx0WvU4-X5XQ.text: Takeout fried rice, the rice is raw! Shrimp is not fresh, the food is awful oily, taste disgusting! Called the restaurant, they said it's not their fault. Will not go back!

sfE0U55C1bfQ6wWON9i54Q.text: Our friends invited us here for dinner  as they have been patronizing this restaurant for 11 years and really enjoyed the Chinese food.  We were greeted by a friendly hostess and  the restaurant has a nice atmosphere.  The waiter we had didn't crack a smile and was very serious throughout the whole dinner service,  never asking if we enjoyed our food or if needed anything else. He was not friendly at all as were all the other servers we noted.  However the owner of the restaurant came and greeted our friends and seemed very friendly and happy. The menu is very nice with typical Chinese dishes and also chef's specialties Vegetarian, healthy dishes and   childs plates also are included in the menu.  The portions are very adequate, prices moderate and the food came out hot and plated very nicely  All  of what we ordered was very tasty.  Our orders included , egg drop soup , hot and sour soup,  wonton soup.  Our main courses were the kings tofu dish   a mixture of tofu,  chicken   shrimp and mushrooms,  a great wall  triple delight,  with chicken and seafood and a  spicy  curry chicken .  We also ordered brown rice instead of white rice and an eggroll as an appetizer for one. Soups were standard basic recipe as well as the egg roll but the dinners really very good  as far as sauces and seasonings. Fried rice would cost extra if desired We would certainly return to try other dishes and hope to get a friendly server next time.
